intro: Chaptalia arechavaletae, commonly known as the Arechavaleta's chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
